body_html:
This PR is now ready for review.

I confess I do not know exactly what 7.2 demon I upset, but the following updates resolved the issue:

(1) I moved the half header template hook into the CUDA ifdef for safety (I verified it is not appearing in c generated code, but it was emitting an extra blank line).
(2) I removed the iostream include from the C++ kernels and added cstdint. This is a bug fix unrelated to the original PR since those kernels were (apparently) relying on iostream including cstdint.
(3) I added the -lm linking directive to the gcc invocation since the C++ kernels include math.h. This is also an unrelated bug fix.

This PR is now ready for review.

I confess I do not know exactly what 7.2 demon I upset, but the following updates resolved the issue:

(1) I moved the half header template hook into the CUDA ifdef for safety (I verified it is not appearing in c generated code, but it was emitting an extra blank line).
(2) I removed the iostream include from the C++ kernels and added cstdint. This is a bug fix unrelated to the original PR since those kernels were (apparently) relying on iostream including cstdint.
(3) I added the -lm linking directive to the gcc invocation since the C++ kernels include math.h. This is also an unrelated bug fix.
